item.title: How to rebase stacked Git branches - Adam Johnson
item.description: When working on a feature, you might split it into several stacked branches, so you can merge each one separately. But updating such branches can be annoying, since you have to manage each one. Git 2.38 (2022-10-15) makes such updates easier, with the ability to rebase a stack of branches at once, with the new --update-refs. Let’s look at a couple of examples.
